Reviews.Title: “overpriced for a dump”
Reviews.Author: hungryEddie
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews before we left for amsterdam and didn't hold out much hope. The stairs at the entrance were almost vertical and then we were charged 50 euro for a room key deposit. Getting the door open was a struggle and we had to get the lady in reception to come and do it because it was near impossible. The room itself(13) was worse than we had anticipated.There was a patio type room next to it where there was 2 windows of the room next door allowing us a full view. It doesn't exactly fill you with confidence. I must say though that the staff were friendly and easy to get on with. I wouldn't recommend this hotel but it was fine for what our group was here to do but i wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: 187514Martin
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a weekend. I paid 120 eur per night for a double bedroom. I have to say that was absolutely AWFUL. We paid a lot for a USELESS room...without Soap in the bathroom or any other facility. We also have been sleeping on the top floor of a discotheque, so basically ALL night the walls of the room were shaking because of the loudly music. The Continental breakfast was HORRIBLE bread ham and cheese. I think that we overpaid for AWFUL ROOM.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this disgusting 'hotel' !”
Reviews.Author: Martin B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is filthy dirty , cramped with everything of the poorest quality , I wouldnt put a dog in here .

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel that I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Tony B
Reviews.Content: The bathroom stank and the bedroom door leading to a back roof was insecure. The bedroom was small and had no proper ammeneties like teamaking, even a rail in the frail wardrobe for coathangers would have been nice. THE WORST PART OF THE STAY WAS THAT THE HOTEL IS 20M AWAY FROM A "CAFE" WHICH BLASTS OUT HEAD BANGING MUSIC UNTIL 3-4am. Despite claims to have 24 hour reception this was more like 8, one of the receceptionists did not even speak English UNDOUBTEDLY THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED AT.

Reviews.Title: “Fair for the price, could have been worse!”
Reviews.Author: TurnipEssex Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The bedding was clean which was a pleasant surprise! Staff kept to the basics and conversation was minimal! Breakfast was basic but filling and ok for the price. Stairs would not be good for those with limited mobility!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Keiffster
Reviews.Content: Right on top of a nigh club, no zircon, absolutely no services or amenities in the room. Room was dirty and not very secure. Walls so thing you everyone on your floor Avoid at all costs

Reviews.Title: “A hovel charging extortionate rates for rooms even a tramp would hate”
Reviews.Author: dixiechick1953
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel any self respecting person should comtemplate experiencing. The service is non-existent and the rooms are disgusting. The pillows were stained and dirty, the sheets did not fit the beds, there were no wardrobes or drawers (in fact, nowhere to either hang or place your clothes), the curtains were hanging off the rails, the windows would only stay open if a piece of wood was wedged underneath, the shower was mouldy and the shower head had to be held to be used, the stairs were dark, dangerous and stank. The paint was peeling off the walls, which were also filthy. A price per room was agreed when booked, but on arrival had increased by 100 euros and if we had chosen not to stay, would still be chargeable.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear”
Reviews.Author: jessicaaarabbit
Reviews.Content: On the whole our four night trip to amsterdam was great. The only negative was this hotel. As soon as we (tried) to cheak in the woman at reception looked at me as though i'd killed someone and said "it not possible" as though she was saying how dare you try and check in early. We thought what a great start. We tried to be optimistic throughout the trip and kind of make a joke of it but on further reflection ive decided that no matter how much you pay for a room or how many stars it has, theres just some things you shouldn't have to put up with (discusting smelly bathroom, dirty bed with sheet that didn't even fit, having to hold the shower head whilst you wash, no soap,fire alarm going off for no reason) im surprised we didn't catch anything really. What id like to know is who gave that hotel two stars! Its not worthy of one. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, Dingey, Overpriced, Fire Hazard & Prison like”
Reviews.Author: Sparklygal74
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Amsterdam & the impression of the city itself is a good one but this hotel is simply dreadful. You will smell the stale cigarette and alcohol smell from 10 feet away from the door and think it belongs to the bar next door. It does not. DO NOT LISTEN TO ANYONE WHO SAYS IT IS NOT THAT BAD REALLY ON THESE REVIEWS. It is not cheap or cheerful! If you choose to ignore the reviews, take earplugs and disinfectant. There was no fire alarm in my room on the top floor, if there had been a fire I would have had no chance. Top floor shower was basically a cupboard with tiles and no mop to clean up, so wear those anti veruca socks or flip flops. Dirty laundry bags laid about int the hall for 2 whole days. Wasn't even brave enough to eat there. The wiring for the electrical applicances was dodgy at best. Don't touch the kettles or fridge if you have one. Don't investigate the beds too closely. BUDGET does not mean DIRTY, DANGEROUS OR SMELLY! In fact JUST DON'T GO.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a go perfect location”
Reviews.Author: michelle-ni
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in march for my bday I read awful reviews and was slightly scared! Although pleasantly surprised.. Rooms were basic but clean and hot water was always available! There is a steep staircase but it's Acually not that anoying and we also managed it very drunk which was a bonus! Staff don't really interact to much with guests although their pleasant and didn't complain about the noise! All in all if you want somewhere to put your head down this is it! Perfect location in the heart of rembrent square with a 10 Minuit walk to dam square

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: cindynix
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you want to get any sleep at all. The place is above a very noisy bar which plays thumping music till 5am each morning - this actually made the beds vibrate and it was like trying to go to sleep in the middle of a night club. It faces out onto Thorbeckeplein which is heaving with noisy revellers till 6 in the morning and the windows have gaps so you can hear everything. The rooms are dirty - our bin hadn't even been emptied and there was a huge mouldy growth on the ceiling of one of the bathrooms Lastly, there is a very rude male staff member who slammed the door in our face when we were unable to pay on check-in - yes, they demand payment on check-in not check-out! - perhaps because so many people leave without paying or refuse to pay and I wouldn't blame them. Expensive for the dive of a place that this is. Do not be deceived by the photos and promises of jacuzzis and mini-bars on the website - outrageously misleading!

Reviews.Title: “Skanky is the word”
Reviews.Author: Vogue1
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, but if you want a 'hotel' experience this is not the place. This is the type of place you leave your bag, and go out again. It is not very comfortable for much longer. Definietly not for children, the stiars are so steep I had to climb them on all fours, and it is just not clean enough. The so called breakfast is a disaster, and is laid out at the reception desk. I would say the 'hotel' is more a hostel, and a skanky one at that. Avoid unless, like I said u want to bed down briefly and just require a roof!

Reviews.Title: “absolutly the worst hotel i have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: stefie2011
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe this hotel is actually being advertised to book! Me and my friends walked in and the 1st thing we noticed was the steep flight of stairs ahead of us... with disgusting red carpet. The 2nd thing we noticed was the stench of the place. It felt like we were in a horror movie, I would go as far as saying that it felt like we had just walked into a brothal! The place is vile. I went away with four of my friends and we book two rooms. We were that scared we all shared the one room. When we asked the receptionist if we could get the 2nd room refunded as we were only staying in one, they refused! The room we stayed in had a little conservatory. It had three windows in there and at any time other guest could climb out and get into our room which was a big concern. A bit of advice, NEVER EVER book to stay there, and dont be tempted by the price its shocking! I hope this review helps. (im not one to complain so please take this advice and USE it!)

Reviews.Title: “Vile hotel NEVER stay here !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eloise123-123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels in some of the poorest country's even one pound a night hotels in thailand are better then this one !!! i went to amsterdam with 6 friends 3 girls 3 guys so we booked two rooms at this place that they call a hotel and we felt so unsafe here we had the guys stay in the room with us due to not using the other room they wouldnt give us a refund !!!! the state of the room was a JOKE!!! we didnt sleep under the covers due to not knowing what would be under there!!!!!! Some ADVICE: NEVER STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “what are you all moaning about!!!!”
Reviews.Author: good_4_u088
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my friend, we only paid Â£140 inc flights which was a bargain! After reading past reviews I was quite scared, when we arrived there is a very steep staircase leading to the reception area, the lady on reception was lovely and so helpful. we stayed in 1 of the aprtments which was a few doors down from the hotel with another steep staircase to the entrance but the room was massive definatly big enough for 4 to stay! it was very clean and couldnt of asked for a better location, everything was in walking distance. As Im a travel agent I asked could we look at a few of the hotel rooms as I really couldnt understand what all these bad reviews was about! Some of the rooms was quite small but still clean so if you want a good base this is the hotel for you. If I went again I would email the hotel receptionist and ask if we could have the apartment again for the space!

Reviews.Title: “Impossible to sleep there!”
Reviews.Author: no_sleep_99
Reviews.Content: I was a bit dubious of some of the reviews on here. I recently stayed for a few days midweek. The hotel itself is not too bad considering it is one of the cheaper hotels in amsterdam (basic and clean-ish).The problem is the location... It's located on the edge of a square full of bars / restaurants / nightclubs, there is even a bar underneath the hotel. The loudest of the nightclubs closes at about 3AM and the drunks do not disperse until at least 4:00AM. Our room wasnt soundproof in any way, and it was quite impossible to sleep until then. After then there is about 4:00 hours of relative quiet (except for the pigeons in the walls). At about 8:00 AM you are brutally awoken again by street cleaning trucks and the sound of all the bars, restaurants cleaning / disposing of thousands of bottles. If your thinking of staying there then unless your going to be comatosed when you stumble into your bed, there is zero chance of any sleep before 4:00 AM. This has got to be the nosiest place for a hotel ever. Saying all that the receptionist was freindly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Unsecure, Filthy, Unfriendly, Worst Hotel Ever, Don't Go”
Reviews.Author: berwickgail
Reviews.Content: This must be the worst hotel in Amsterdam. We had booked in for 3 nights. When we arrived we had to climb over rubbish on the staircase to get to our rooms, if you can call them that. We booked 2 twin rooms looking over the Square. We ended up with 2 rooms with interlocking door that never closed or locked. One never had a window and the other was a glass door which never had a lock or a handle on it and was kept closed with a table at the back of it. There was no way we could have left anything in the room. There was mould in the bathroom and also on the beds as well as the ceilings. The bath had dirt coming out of the jets, I think it must have been a jacuzzi style bath in its time. When we went to complain at reception we were told it is what it is. We ended up leaving that hotel and booking into another but ended up paying for the first night without staying there. I am very surprised this hotel is allowed to stay open and even more surprised that holiday companies like last minute.com are still taking bookings for it. I have always been very open minded about going on holiday and never took much notice of reviews but please, please take notice of this one and don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: DisgustedAgain
Reviews.Content: We were desperate so we stayed here. The photos on-line didn't at all represent the room we stayed in. We were on the top or next to top floor overlooking a shed roof littered with used condoms and discarded needles. In the fridge we found a half bottle of wine and a chunk of old moldy cheese which must have been there for weeks. We literally put more clothes on to go to bed than we wore all day. In the morning we did not shower or brush our teeth but ran for the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location , reviews a bit over the top.”
Reviews.Author: MarkDavies
Reviews.Content: Dont get me wrong this is not the ritz and far from but you are not paying ritz prices . On my arrival after reading the reviews i was a little worried , checked in at two and was on top floor so was big treck as i carried mine and my partners cases up about hundred stairs. The room was small but it was only for two , there was two beds a table two chairs a fridge and tv and the room was clean and comphy. The shared facilites were clean and the shower was fantasticly warm and so was the room . The room was only a base for 5 days and it was exactly that all we needed it for was to sleep and wash . The location was excellent , plenty of bars , shops , and plenty of places to eat within rembrant square. Tram strait across the road and links the whole city and we bought 4 day pass for 18.00 euros well worth it must have used the tram 20/30 times. The city is fantastic , the hotel was clean , freindly and warm if you want ritz style rooms go to the ritz if you pay the price for for the thorbecke you get what you would expect A BASE .

Reviews.Title: “what a way to celebrate my 40th!”
Reviews.Author: lelHScotland
Reviews.Content: arrived at this hotel, an couldnt get checked in as the receptionist had gone for somethin to eat!!Steep flight of stairs to reception and comin down them, take ur life in ur hands with large glass window at the bottom!! Rooms r another steep stair level up! My god, room was a disgrace! Filthy, smelt of damp and urine, and very small. TV broke down 1st night we were there. My partner (well, ex) forked out extra for the 4 star hotel round the corner as the thorbecke is disgustin. Great location, but dont chance staying here, just incase u get room 14!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: caroline0199sky
Reviews.Content: 6 of us shared 2 bedrooms. The configuration was 4 single beds crammed into one room (3 of them pushed together) with an adjoining room having two single beds pushed together and not much room either side. Each bedroom had a bathroom and ours smelt really bad; a damp, musty smell, probably coming from what looked like a damp patch on the ceiling. Ours had a bath with a shower head attached to the mixer tap. The other room had a proper shower and this smelt OK. The large room had a small room leading off it with seats and a table, which led onto a small balcony, which you could fall off into the garden below as there was no barrier. Even more dangerous than the steep stairs up to the rooms. There was a safe in the large room, but this was a joke as it was not fixed to anything! We did leave our passports in the room in our bags and luckily they were still there at the end of our stay. The bedrooms had badly fitted laminate flooring and bathrooms tiles. Some friend in other rooms, on different floors said they had old carpets, so I suppose we were lucky. There is a disco bar below the hotel, which does not close until 4 to 5 am in the morning so you are kept awake by bump, bump, bump coming through the floor boards. The breakfast was not too bad. There was a choice of boiled eggs, ham, cheese, jams etc to put on your toast and a good range of teas, plus coffee and orange juice to drink. There was a PC in the dining room available for free internet. The receptionist was nice and friendly. The location is very good. A 20 minute walk or short tram ride from the central train station. There are lots of bars, coffee shops, night clubs, and restaurants etc in Rembrandt square, where the hotel is. There was a very large broadcasting convention on the weekend of our stay so the prices had probably been increased and the good hotels booked up. We paid about Â£150 each for the 2 night bed and breakfast. Expensive considering how bad this hotel was. I would never go back to this hotel again and I am only glad this was a lad's only weekend and that I hadn't taken my wife here!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: suzywong22
Reviews.Content: i booked the hotel before reading the reviews. when i read them i was a bit afraid on what i was going to see when i got there, BUT IT WAS OK..... from the out side it didnt look as clean as the photos , then i had to climb what seemed to be millions of stairs to the reception. The lady who greeted us there was nice and all paperwork was confirmed which i wasglad because i had never booked on line before. On entering the room i was a bit apprehensive but it had what it said bed, bathroom, shower, television, kettle and fridge. AND IT WAS CLEAN.....breakfast was a continental and was served by pleasant people.. you could have a varity of things to eat. they had a computer there which you could use i expect at a small charge they even let a gentleman use there printer to print off his tickets which i thought was nice of them. Lilke i said it was clean , nice, and though it was a one star i would give it a two star... and you get what you pay for.......

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother save your money!”
Reviews.Author: Dellarina
Reviews.Content: Not nice whatsoever.......Dirty dirty dirty.....damp beds, flea bites what more can i say!

Reviews.Title: “Apartment was great”
Reviews.Author: fatboytim
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at Hotel Damrak Inn. Had a bad experience. We got a private room 3 bed apartment and it was great. Roomy. TV was not great but we didn't care. Had a stove, refrigerator and a microwave. Terrace area was nice. Area is loud at night because of the bars. That didn't bother me. If you stay at Thorbecke get an apartment.

Reviews.Title: “You get your money's worth!”
Reviews.Author: Aci_89
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from Amsterdam and stayed here for 3 nights. all i can say is you get what you pay for. We got there and we knew we the hotel was on top of the night club, but holy cow it was loud. We didnt mind to to much but we just slept in the day to catch up. The bed was comfy, and the room had tea and coffee facilities and it has a tv in the room. however in the about a day of staying there the toilet started to smell of sewage. in the end we had to block all the sink holes to stop the smell. the shower was broken and to be honest the whole bathroom needed a clean. Whilst we stayed there they started cleaning, we asked if they could come back as we needed to sleep and they said no, for the whole time we were there we never got our room cleaned, towels changed, bin emptied. the staff were unhelpful. we never made breakfast so dunno how that is. at night when the nightclub is opening, they left there doors open and we couldnt even get into our hotel. you have to get the bouncers attention so you can actually gte to your hotel door otherwise you have to cue! to be honest i wouldnt stay here again. we would normally stay at hotel atlanta, which is just over the square and much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful, what an awful experience”
Reviews.Author: mikethemix
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting here at 2:50 am and still cant to sleep due to the noisy music from (empty) night club downstairs. The Indonesian guy on reception with poor english says nothing can be done, I have to leave for an early flight and am considering napping at Schipol instead. Room is VERY basic, dangerous wiring, plg falling off wall, one of room lights doesn't work, dont think I dare use the bath. Wish I had rea\d the other reviews in here before booking in a hurry yesterday, I wanted something close to Rembrant square, but this is the pits.

Reviews.Title: “Thorbecke on Queensday; not even that bad”
Reviews.Author: Foodfan617
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 days surrounding Queensday in Amsterdam and had an Okay experience at the Thorbecke. The other negative reviews are not all wrong but perhaps a little over zealous in their criticism. The stairs were extremely steep, but there are railings all the way up and it is manageable if you do not have disabilities. There are shared and private bath options, we chose shared to save money. That being said overall a relatively good value for money given the location and compared to pensioner alternatives. 10-20% overpriced, considering: Negatives: Small room- ours was in the attic, with one leg of the bed missing (only affects anything if you plan to curl into a ball at the bottom end of the bed), no soap the first day but shampoo and body wash packets were present. The attic shower room was atrocious and could definitely scare some people. It was 3 meters long and built into the size of the attic (one side sloped in), only with one light and completely tiled so a bit like an insane asylum. Toilet room: all white, clean, soap, and toilet paper stocked...there WAS a bit of mold/gunk on the ground but it was a small puddle the size of a wallet maybe from a dipping heating pipe, and in the very corner of the room. NOT something to go crazy over. Simple breakfast Positives: good towels, and linen quality, nicely arranged room for its size; two guys for three days worked fine in there. Shower room: clean and acceptable/good water pressure, Toilet room: clean. Breakfast is NOT bad. Simple yes. The internet services the same room you have breakfast in and is open 24 hours per day. High speed wireless connection but no privacy if you want to use internet calling as the doorman is situated into this room a bit. Very helpful staff, if a bit limited on English skills. German fluency would help, or obviously being from the Netherlands too. Showed where to go, advised critically how to get out of the city in time for our flight given the fact that Queensday madness would limit our ability to move through the city Breakfast Includes boiled eggs, white/wheat toast, jams/jellies/peanut butter, ham and cheese slices, and fresh milk, orange juice (from concentrate), water for tea and I must say very good coffee. Location is exactly 25 minutes from central station walking at a brisk pace through light crowds. Tram number 9 (from the middle of the central station, not the right side when you walk out from your trains!! - caution) is 1.60 euro and takes only four stops to Rembrandtplein (plaza/square). Hotel thorbecke is just off square, and I mean just off you cannot miss it if you walk straight from the tram stop to the south more. Final notes: there is a nightclub that queue's up in front of the entrance to hotel about 11 pm. Thorbecke sign is on about floor 2 of the building. Young crowds will fare better here. The door problem that others gripe about has been solved. It slams after you walk in :) As of April 2009, I Amsterdam sign is at the WTC plaza on the southern side of The South Central Station

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Budget Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: lambelafloors
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews I must admit I was a bit sceptical but upon arrival at the hotel I was pleasantly surprised. The room was generally clean, nothing fantastic but basic and reasonably comfortable. It is in an excellent location but one draw back in a busy bar underneath. We stayed on the first floor so noise wasnt too much of a problem but I am sure if you stayed on the lower floor you might need earplugs. As with most dutch properties the stairs are v steep so if you have mobility problems I would not recommend. All in all its a basic budget hotel in an excellent location, perfect for younger travellers who just need a base and somewhere to kip. If you want something a bit more luxorious then this is not the hotel for you. Ps They did ask for a 25 euro key deposit but this was returned without question on check out.

Reviews.Title: “Dont even consider staying here.”
Reviews.Author: scottfin
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel i have ever encountered in my life. The sneaky receptionist asked for â‚¬50 as a deposit then refused to give it back on leaving. We had a third person staying so i asked for an extra bed - she claimed she did not understand english and would not discuss. On checking out she said there was a 3rd person in the room (which we had told her the previous day) and now she could speak english. I wouldnt have minded paying if they had provided an additional roll a way bed but went out there way not to do so. Thiefs. Dishonest. And the rooms were disgustingly dirty as posted elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience...”
Reviews.Author: angrypreg
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? The entrance: you are greeted by a very steep staircase and the first thing we were asked was to pay upfront!!! We paid almost â‚¬300 for 2 nights: the worst value for money in my entire life... To get to our room there were two floors of even steeper staircases: luckily my husband was there, because being pregnant I would have not been able to bring my suitcase to the room!!! So, if you have any 'mobility' problem, or it just happen that you are pregnant like me, please avoid this hotel... The carpet in the staircase was dirty and I think a thousand years old!!! Our room was the smallest room ever: you could go around the double bed (two single mattresses of two frames) only from one side. The bathroom was moldy, including the shower curtain!!! We only got one towel each and although in the website there was written that there was the hair dryer, there was in fact no sign of it (like the alleged minibar).... The towels were changed the second day, but the bed was not done which is something it never happen to me, especially when you have paid â‚¬300 for two nights. The breakfast was less than essential: toast slides, jam, a couple of slices of cheese and ham (very poor quality) and an hard boiled egg!!! We didn't manage to get any sleep because of the number of night club, restaurant and so on open until 5am!!! On the whole, the worst experience ever: dirty, small, shabby place, expensive too!!! Thank God we stayed only two days!!!

Reviews.Title: “MIce traps and droppings everywhere”
Reviews.Author: chrisportland
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be the worst experience ever. They demanded we pay up front for all four nights,so we really didn't know what we were getting into until we saw our first room. It was horrible with mouse droppings every where and very dirty looking bed linens. My brother and I slept in our clothes with towels over the pillows that night. We figured that was the only way to survive the dismal place. We were told we would have a new room the second night. We had hoped it would be an improvement, but it was just as bad or worse. There were mouse traps under each bed and many mouse droppings all over. The next morning early we decided to find a new place. We had to get out of there. When we checked out before 11:00 we asked to have the next two night's money returned, but they refused. We paid $170 US for this hotel per night. We paid $ 165 US for a beautiful hotel right in the middle of Barcelona,so I guess it difficult to know for sure what you might be in for. Skip this dump !!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my God”
Reviews.Author: dannyManchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace.Upon arrival you could see it was dirty,dull,and very unplesant to spend a holiday in.Our room was no more than an attic,the wardrobe had no doors on it,the carpet was very old and dirty,our only window was a skylight with ripped curtans,the washbasin had broken tiles,we had no room service for three days,but worst of all was the electrics,very dangrous,the plug wires were exposed,plugs would not fit properly to sockets.The stairs were very steep and dirty,this hotel was the worst Ihave ever stayed in,NEVER NEVER AGAIN oh and forget about breakfast I mean it.Glad to leave this place.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Poor Show”
Reviews.Author: kelster030
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Thorbeke hotel. Worst hotel we have ever had the displeasure of staying at Upon entry walking up what felt like Mount everest on an extremely dirty carpet gave us a glipse of things to come. Staying in an allegedly non-smoking room we were greeted with the stench of stale smoke and an ashtray on the table. We payed extra for the privaledge of a 'city view'. Do not take this route as we were greeted with tree branches and nothing more. If there were a city view, we wouldn't have seen much due to the badly cracked window payne We then discovered that the bathroom door handle was broken when it came of in our hand! along with the fact there was no light in there. This took over 2 days to get fixed, after constant badgering. Bedding was not nice. Smelt a bit and the sheets were actually duvet covers with the matresses larger than the bases. Best was yet to come in the form of what can loosly be termed as breakfast. orange juice, tea, an egg, toast and jam. One morning we couldnt even get orange juice. If you want a hot shower in the morning forget it. Even at 9am in the morning there was no hot water for a shower! There was a bedside light that was unable to be pluged in, and the light switch to the main light was a grubby cord Staff were not really that helpful and looked pretty miserable at all times, but then again, so i would i if i had to work there getting numerous complaints each day. All in all a pretty poor show - stayed in much nicer hostels - and would never dare to cross the doorstep of this grotty place again and would definately not recommend to anyone. Gotta be better places in Amsterdam than this!

Reviews.Title: “Security big let down”
Reviews.Author: jonsey_uk
Reviews.Content: you do get what you pay for, particulary the brekfast, a bit of toast that you have to make yourself! a slice of cheese and a hard boiled egg. The location is good but security in the hotel is terrible. The main door to the hotel does not shut properly and on the last night my mates phone and money were stolen from the rooom, the guy on reception said he thought the person was one of our mates!! And when we asked to look at CCTV we were told that the camera they have does not video it just takes pictures!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thorbecke - A Complete Joke”
Reviews.Author: mydarlin
Reviews.Content: I booked an apartment via on-line with Bookings,com, roughly two months prior. As there were three of us, one couple and a single i thought the apartment would be best, we could all be together but the advertised seperate bedroom would give you privacy and as we were on a bit of a budget the kitchen would be very handy. It was advertised as spacious, with all modcons sperate bedroom, kitchen, bathroom with a bath etc... I could not believe that they wanted to charge us 504 Euro for 3 nights for what we actually got. It was roughtly the same size as a double room, with a massive bed and the third bed was a laughable camp bed right next to the double!! No seperate bedroom as advertised and yes there was a kitchen with 3 cups and one glass! NO kettle, No Hob, No microwave, No oven ( one of these would have been better than nothing? )NO cutlery, plates etc.. Basically it was just a fridge, sink and worktop. Now i thought it were common knowledge that apartments have a functioning kitchen? Anyway EVERYTHING listed in the booking was basically a load of rubbish. It were also very grubby, stuff splattered on the walls, the walls in the room were not even painted and looked like a proper rush job. The staff were pretty much useless, thet did bring us a hob down from somewhere but had no pots/pans plates and cutlery so it didnt get used.. We did however manage to get a kettle. We were left waiting to check in as the room was not ready - i honestly think they rustled this room up last minute, they even told us its only a room for two anyway!!! Basically we paid for a lot of things that were not actually included but were advertised. By the time the whole checking in was done it was about 6PM. If you are thinking about using the aoartments please considar this before you book. Its actually worse than hostel aprtments and cost more money. No free drink, no bar, no apologies just greedy greedy greedy.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: Hamsterdamed
Reviews.Content: Due to a huge media conference in Amsterdam the Thorbecke hotel had the only available rooms. In hindsight sleeping in a canal may have been better. - The stairs to reception are suitable for only a clear headed mountain goat. - The 'room for 6' contained 2 rooms with 4 x single and one double bed with barely enough room to squeeze past each bed. - 'Basic' is an undertstatement, decrepid is more fitting - 5 out of the 6 of us were covered in insect bites on the second morning The only saving feature is the location right slap band in the middle of things but then again so are plenty of other hotels ! Don't stay there...........

Reviews.Title: “YUCK: Loud and there non-smoking rooms well REEKED”
Reviews.Author: GabalishCA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was dirty, reeked of cigarettes, even though we had a non-smoking room but had great customer service. Our room had a street view right above the check in counter. At night it was EXTREMLY loud! The overall feel of the room was dirty. The hotel had a club/bar located next door. Upon check in the guy at the counter gave each of us a free drink ticket for there â€œspecialtyâ€� shot. Overall it was in a good location but I donâ€™t think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugCheltenham
Reviews.Content: if your idea of staying in a hotel suite above a nightclub, being kept awake with drum and bass night (Saturdays) til 5am is an ideal break away - you'll love this venue! we booked a suite for 6 people - the two joined rooms were depressingly different from the reasonably looking pictures on the internet and the sign outside the hotel - you pay upon arrival - then they give you the keys to the suite. don't be deceived by the breakfast included - it's a combination of Leerdammer cheese, sliced bread and when you're lucky a boiled egg... mmm! don't worry about asking for hotel safe facilities - you'll get the response that that's what the staff are paid for - and a bonus that you have your own doormen on the nightclub entrance downstairs (right next to the entrance to the hotel) - so you'll feel extra safe at night.... at Â£30 each per night, Â£180 per night in total, there are other hotels out there offering much better facilities. there's no doubt the location is great - but earplugs won't keep the bass line of the music out.... Friday nights however are toe-tappingly great until 5am.....

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: leedsgentleman
Reviews.Content: We went as a party of 10 lads in November and stayed a Friday night in this hotel. To be honest it wasn't the best place in the world but what do you expect for the money? We had 3 rooms booked: a 6 ensuite bedroom (295 Euros), a ensuite 2 bedroom (95 Euros), 2 bedroom (75 Euros) so it cost us approx 47 Euros each which aint bad for a cheap and chearful city centre hotel in Amsterdam on a Friday night. There was a massive surcharge however for me paying on credit card - about an extra 40 Euros. The lady at the reception was also quite friendley. The beds were comfy and the location was really good as it was close to everything. One piece of advice if staying in the attic rooms - the steps are proper steep, make sure your head is in a good state when attempting to climb the stairs!!

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm”
Reviews.Author: chicken
Reviews.Content: Well where do i start.......? it looked nice in the pictures its situated above a bar which does not shut untill 5am yes 5 in the morning lets put it this way its good if you want to party all night! do not expect to get any sleep and i mean we were on the 3rd floor i feel sorry for the people on the floor above the bar itself. you can literally have a party in your room using the music from downstairs! we moved after 2 nights to the "artemis hotel" (now that IS a nice hotel) as none of us were getting sleep and you dont get your money back so its not even worth a try breakfast was ok if you like bread jam and cheese oh and a boiled egg GREAT the hotel isnt too badly placed it comes out in to a nice square where you can sit and chill with a beer if your hungry walk down the road to "wok to walk" hmmm i wish we had those in England! room are very small and basic you do get a television we didnt have a romote to match it though although you do get bbc 1 or 2

Reviews.Title: “pretttty dodgy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well the place was bearable, but rather depressing. Donâ€™t be fooled by the â€˜breakfast includedâ€™ as it was meagre beyond a doubt and needless to say, we did not bother going down the second morning. The room I stayed in was a double ensuite. It was very musky and just oozed uncleanliness. Although the man who was at the desk was polite enough, you couldnâ€™t ignore the shifty look of him. I went in September with my boyfriend at 100 euro a night for the two of us. We originally booked three nights but decided to leave it at two as soon as we saw the reception area. The only good thing about the place was the ease at which the dodgy looking man at the desk allowed us to cancel our third night. Anyway long story short, the room was shabby, the breakfast did not deserve the name breakfast, and there was an underlying general unsafe feeling in the place and the worst thing was, it wasnt that cheap. I would never return there or recommend it to anyone. and yes i also had to pay upfront and was not told about the free drink so remember to ask

Reviews.Title: “Good for a budget choice”
Reviews.Author: If_only_I_were_rich
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights in the Thorbecke Hotel in Aug 05, we chose the hotel because it had rooms, cheap, last minute and is in a good location. The hotel is perfectly situated for seeing the city, just off the bustling Remdrandtplein with tram links. The rooms are all above a bar downstairs and the one we had was definately clean but reflected the price we paid for it with respect to furniture, view, quality of decor etc. The beds were very comfortable though and we found that being on the 3rd floor it wasn't too noisy at night. Breakfast is served by the very polite hotel staff and consisted of fresh orange juice, tea/coffee, basket of bread with jams, plate of sliced cheese and a boiled egg each. This was definately ample and the bread was nice etc. I would certainly recommend the hotel to any young travellers on a budget because it is so ideally placed and because the staff were pleasent, rates cheap and rooms adequate.

HotelInfo.Name: Thorbecke Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Thorbeckeplein 3, Amsterdam 1017, The Netherlands
